statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Trelun Banks scored 21 points and Southern held on to beat Alabama State 73-69 on Saturday night for its fifth straight win.
article.headline: Southern U holds on to beat Alabama State 73-69
article.linkText: Southern U holds on to beat Alabama State 73-69
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. -- Trelun Banks scored 21 points and Southern held on to beat Alabama State 73-69 on Saturday night for its fifth straight win. Jared Sam added 15 points and Adrian Rodgers had 11 for the Jaguars (13-7, 5-2 Southwestern Athletic Conference), who are 7-0 at home. Jamel Waters scored 22 points for Alabama State (6-12, 1-5). Tony Armstrong had 12 points and Corvon Butler 11. Waters forced a turnover then scored a layup to give Alabama State its last lead, 66-65 with 3:34 remaining. Rashad Andrews had a layup, Banks hit a 3-pointer and Sam made 1 of 2 free throws to give the Jaguars a 71-66 lead with 1:16 left. Torloft Thomas made a free throw, and then had a steal which led to Terrance Leflore's layup, pulling Alabama State to 71-69 with a minute left. The Hornets missed their next four shots, and Rodgers had a dunk to seal it.
